mapper.sql: id, username, password, role, status, created, modified
mapper.insert: insert into admin (id, username, password, role, status, created, modified) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{role,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{created,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{modified,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})

insert into admin
id,
username,
password,
role,
status,
created,
modified,

mapper.update:
update admin
username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
role = #{role,jdbcType=INTEGER},
status = #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER},
created = #{created,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
modified = #{modified,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update admin set username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, role = #{role,jdbcType=INTEGER}, status = #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, created = #{created,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modified = #{modified,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select count(id) from admin where username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and status!=-1
select count(id) from admin where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

select
from admin where username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and status!=-1
